info.title: friends-api
info.description:
RallyHere Friends API. These set of APIS will are used to manage a Players list of Friends and Blocked Players.
*Note*: When the other Player declines the Player's Friend request, the FriendShip status is set to "FRIENDSHIP_DECLINED_BY_OTHER_PLAYER" and counts towards the Player's Friend limit. Clients are expected to delete the relationship and optionally inform the Player about the declined request.

get.summary: Get Friends List For Player V2
get.description:
Fetch the friend's list for the Player and their relationship status with those friends.
    
*Note*: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response. 

Clients can utilize the `if-none-match` header to avoid having to reload the response if it has not changed.

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

schema.title: If-None-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

parameters.name: if-none-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

304.description: Content still has the same etag and has not changed

delete.description: Remove the friend's relationship status with the other players

get.description:
Get the relationship status with the other Player.
                    
*Note*: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response.

Clients can then utilize the `if-none-match` header to avoid having to reload the response if it has not changed or to use it to modify the relationship without loosing updates.

Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:read

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

schema.title: If-None-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

parameters.name: if-none-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

304.description: Content still has the same etag and has not changed

put.description:
Modify the friend's relationship status with the other Player. There is a max number of friends that can be added for a Player.
                    
The limit can determined using [this API](/#/Configuration%20V1/get_friends_and_block_limits). This API allows you optionally update the player's notes for the other player. If you do not want to update or set the notes when adding the other player, then do not include a body.

*Note*: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response and will match the etag value provided when [fetching Friend Relationship between these two players](/#/Friends%20V1/get_friend_relationship). It is highly recommended to provide the etag value with the `if-match` header to avoid lost updates.

Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:write

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

schema.title: If-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

parameters.name: if-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

412.description: The resource's Etag does not match the Etag provided. Get the Etag from the Get request and try again

delete.description:
Remove the friend's relationship status with the other Player. 
                    
This should be used for declining Friend requests, deleting sent Friends Requests, and deleting Friends

*Note*: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response and will match the etag value provided when [fetching Friend Relationship between these two players](#/Friends V1/get_friend_relationship). It is highly recommended to provide the etag value with the `if-match` header to avoid lost updates.
 
Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:write

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

schema.title: If-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

parameters.name: if-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

412.description: The resource's Etag does not match the Etag provided. Get the Etag from the Get request and try again

put.description:
Update Player's notes on the other player. Players can only add notes for players they have relationship's with. The notes will be removed when the relationship is ended.

Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:write

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

schema.title: If-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

parameters.name: if-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

delete.description:
Remove the Player's notes on the other player. Players can only add notes for players they have relationship's with. The notes will be removed when the relationship is ended.
    
Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:write

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

schema.title: If-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

parameters.name: if-match

get.summary: Get Blocked List For Player V2
get.description:
Fetch the blocked list for the Player.
    
*Note*: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response. 
                        
Clients can utilize the `if-none-match` header to avoid having to reload the response if it has not changed.

Permissions Required: friend:block_list:read

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

schema.title: If-None-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

parameters.name: if-none-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

304.description: Content still has the same etag and has not changed

get.description:
Get the Blocked Player
    
Permissions Required: friend:block_list:read

put.description:
Block the other Player. There is a max number of Players that can be blocked per Player.

The limit can determined using [this API](/#/Configuration%20V1/get_friends_and_block_limits).

Permissions Required: friend:block_list:write

delete.description:
Unblock the other Player
    
Permissions Required: friend:block_list:write

get.description:
Get the player_uuid of the player who referred this player.

Required Permissions:

- For any player (including themselves) : `refer:read:any`

- For the player themselves : `refer:read:self`

parameters.description: The referred player_uuid to get the referrer for

schema.title: Player Uuid
schema.description: The referred player_uuid to get the referrer for

parameters.name: player_uuid

403.description:
Error Codes:
- `auth_invalid_key_id` - Invalid Authorization - Invalid Key ID in Access Token
- `auth_invalid_version` - Invalid Authorization - version
- `auth_malformed_access` - Invalid Authorization - malformed access token
- `auth_not_jwt` - Invalid Authorization
- `auth_token_expired` - Token is expired
- `auth_token_format` - Invalid Authorization - {}
- `auth_token_invalid_claim` - Token contained invalid claim value: {}
- `auth_token_invalid_type` - Invalid Authorization - Invalid Token Type
- `auth_token_sig_invalid` - Token Signature is invalid
- `auth_token_unknown` - Failed to parse token
- `insufficient_permissions` - Insufficient Permissions

post.description:
Set a player's referrer using either a player_uuid or referral code.

Required Permissions:

- For any player (including themselves) : `refer:set:any`

- For the player themselves : `refer:set:self`

parameters.description: The player_uuid to set the referrer for

schema.title: Player Uuid
schema.description: The player_uuid to set the referrer for

parameters.name: player_uuid

schema.title: Referrer
schema.description: The referrer to set for the player
